first.description: Non-boss enemies have 20% more health and inflict up to 30% increased damage.This affix will affect every dungeon on a  Fortified week.
first.name: Fortified

second.description: Non-boss enemies enrage at 30% health remaining, dealing 50% increased damage until defeated. When this affix is active, AoE and cleave damage can be dangerous. Be sure to mark a priority target in each pull, and when that target  Enrages, focus fire to bring it down quickly. Stuns and other forms of CC can be used to reduce the damage the party will take from  Enraged mobs. Enraged mobs will keep the  Enrage affix even if they are healed about 30% for any reason.
second.name: Raging

third.description: Periodically, all players emit a shockwave, inflicting damage and interrupting nearby allies.
third.name: Quaking

fourth.description: Enemies have 5% more health. While in combat, players are periodically overcharged with primal power from Raszageth's unending storm. This power comes with great risk, and failure to discharge it quickly can have stunning consequences.
fourth.name: Thundering

first.description: Bosses have 30% more health. Bosses and their minions inflict up to 15% increased damage.
first.name: Tyrannical

second.description: When slain, non-boss enemies explode, causing all players to suffer damage over 4 sec. This effect stacks.
second.name: Bursting

third.description: Injured players suffer increasing damage over time until healed.
third.name: Grievous

fourth.description: Enemies have 5% more health. While in combat, players are periodically overcharged with primal power from Raszageth's unending storm. This power comes with great risk, and failure to discharge it quickly can have stunning consequences.
fourth.name: Thundering

first.description: Non-boss enemies have 20% more health and inflict up to 30% increased damage.This affix will affect every dungeon on a  Fortified week.
first.name: Fortified

second.description: Whenever a non-boss enemy dies, a pool of  Sanguine Ichor forms at its location, starting from the point it died and expanding. This spell has two effects:Sanguine Ichor heals enemies standing within it for 5% of their health each second Sanguine Ichor deals damage to players standing within it for 15% of their health each second
second.name: Sanguine

third.description: While in combat, enemies periodically cause gouts of flame to erupt beneath the feet of distant players.
third.name: Volcanic

fourth.description: Enemies have 5% more health. While in combat, players are periodically overcharged with primal power from Raszageth's unending storm. This power comes with great risk, and failure to discharge it quickly can have stunning consequences.
fourth.name: Thundering

first.description: Bosses have 30% more health. Bosses and their minions inflict up to 15% increased damage.
first.name: Tyrannical

second.description: Non-boss enemies enrage at 30% health remaining, dealing 50% increased damage until defeated. When this affix is active, AoE and cleave damage can be dangerous. Be sure to mark a priority target in each pull, and when that target  Enrages, focus fire to bring it down quickly. Stuns and other forms of CC can be used to reduce the damage the party will take from  Enraged mobs. Enraged mobs will keep the  Enrage affix even if they are healed about 30% for any reason.
second.name: Raging

third.description: While in combat, enemies periodically summon damaging whirlwinds.
third.name: Storming

fourth.description: Enemies have 5% more health. While in combat, players are periodically overcharged with primal power from Raszageth's unending storm. This power comes with great risk, and failure to discharge it quickly can have stunning consequences.
fourth.name: Thundering

first.description: Non-boss enemies have 20% more health and inflict up to 30% increased damage.This affix will affect every dungeon on a  Fortified week.
first.name: Fortified

second.description: Fiends rise from the corpses of non-boss enemies and pursue random player.
second.name: Spiteful

third.description: Injured players suffer increasing damage over time until healed.
third.name: Grievous

fourth.description: Enemies have 5% more health. While in combat, players are periodically overcharged with primal power from Raszageth's unending storm. This power comes with great risk, and failure to discharge it quickly can have stunning consequences.
fourth.name: Thundering

first.description: Bosses have 30% more health. Bosses and their minions inflict up to 15% increased damage.
first.name: Tyrannical

second.description: Whenever a non-boss enemy dies, a pool of  Sanguine Ichor forms at its location, starting from the point it died and expanding. This spell has two effects:Sanguine Ichor heals enemies standing within it for 5% of their health each second Sanguine Ichor deals damage to players standing within it for 15% of their health each second
second.name: Sanguine

third.description: While in combat, enemies periodically summon Explosive Orbs that will detonate if not destroyed.
third.name: Explosive

fourth.description: Enemies have 5% more health. While in combat, players are periodically overcharged with primal power from Raszageth's unending storm. This power comes with great risk, and failure to discharge it quickly can have stunning consequences.
fourth.name: Thundering

first.description: Non-boss enemies have 20% more health and inflict up to 30% increased damage.This affix will affect every dungeon on a  Fortified week.
first.name: Fortified

second.description: When any non-boss enemy dies, its death cry empowers nearby allies, temporarily increasing their maximum health by 15% and damage by 20%.          Enemies who die will buff other nearby enemies which are in combat with  Bolster, causing them to gain 20% health and deal 20% additional damage. This can stack multiple times, resulting in an extremely dangerous enemy that will take a long time to defeat. The range on the buffing ability is 30 yards.
second.name: Bolstering

third.description: While in combat, enemies periodically summon damaging whirlwinds.
third.name: Storming

fourth.description: Enemies have 5% more health. While in combat, players are periodically overcharged with primal power from Raszageth's unending storm. This power comes with great risk, and failure to discharge it quickly can have stunning consequences.
fourth.name: Thundering

second.description: Fiends rise from the corpses of non-boss enemies and pursue random player.

third.name: Quaking
